subject: Negotiation
title: Rio Tinto and the Mining Rights Wars
description: A quick, practical guide to Rio Tinto and the Mining Rights Wars.

hook.text: Mining companies negotiate with entire governments for rights to dig up their land for decades.

buildup.text: Rio Tinto has negotiated mining concessions across Africa, Australia, and South America.

discovery.text: These deals balance corporate profit against national sovereignty, jobs, and environmental protection.

twist.text: Countries that negotiated poorly in the 1990s are now renegotiating as commodity prices soar.

climax.text: The lesson: resource deals must account for future value, not just today's price.

punchline.text: A deal that ignores the future will be rewritten by it.

quiz.question: Why are many countries renegotiating old mining deals?
options: Original deals didn't account for rising commodity values
